meanings.definition: The state of being partially retired, typically working part-time or reducing hours.
meanings.sent1: After many years of hard work, John decided to embrace semiretirement and spend more time with his family.
meanings.sent2: Many people find semiretirement to be a great way to enjoy life while still earning some income.
meanings.sent3: In his semiretirement, Tom became the go-to person for gardening tips in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Semiretirement is like having one foot in the work world and the other foot in relaxation paradise.
meanings.sent5: The concept of semiretirement allows individuals to find a balance between work and personal time.

meanings.definition: To transition from full-time work to a more relaxed schedule, often involving a mix of work and leisure activities.
meanings.sent1: After years of dedication, Sarah decided to semiretirement and enjoy life at a slower pace.
meanings.sent2: Many professionals choose to semiretirement as a way to ease into a more flexible lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: The idea of semiretirement seemed daunting at first, but soon became a welcomed change for Mark.
meanings.sent4: Semiretirement can be a gentle glide into a new chapter of life, blending work and play seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: She decided to semiretirement gracefully, savoring each moment of freedom and relaxation.
